metadata.name: Suspicious Binary In User Directory Spawned From Office Application
metadata.comment: Detects an executable in the users directory started from one of the Microsoft Office suite applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, Visio)

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\winword.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\excel.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\powerpnt.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\mspub.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\visio.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\msaccess.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\eqnedt32.exe'))) AND startswith(lower(process.name), lower('c:\\users\\')) AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('.exe')) AND NOT endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\teams.exe')))

output.summary: Detects an executable in the users directory started from one of the Microsoft Office suite applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, Visio)

metadata.objective: Examine fields: process.cmd_line, process.parent_process.cmd_line False positive: Unknown References: https://blog.morphisec.com/fin7-not-finished-morphisec-spots-new-campaign, https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/23160972c6ae07f740800fa28e421a81d7c0ca5d5cab95bc082b4a986fbac57
